title: These drone operators used to make 'nice' YouTube videos. Now they record alleged Russian war crimes
description: A gray car speeds on a highway near Kyiv, heading towards the Ukrainian capital. As it approaches a Russian position, it does a sharp U-turn, stopping shortly after.

title: Drone video team turns the tables on hiding Russian vehicle
description: CNN's Frederik Pleitgen shows how the use of drones is helping Ukrainian citizens fight the Russian invasion.

title: 6 key points about China's military after top US general issues warning
description: China and Russia are bent on changing the "rules-based current global order," according to America's top general.

title: Polish president: 'Hard to deny' genocide took place in Ukraine
description: CNN Chief Political Correspondent Dana Bash sits down with Polish President Andrzej Duda to get his thoughts about the disturbing images from Ukraine showing dead civilians in areas once occupied by Russia.

title: 'Serious incident' on Air France flight under investigation
description: French aviation safety investigators have opened a probe after an Air France Boeing 777 airplane approaching Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport was involved in a "serious incident," according to BEA, the French bureau that investigates air crashes and aviation safety.

title: Chelsea suffers Champions League defeat against Real Madrid as club's future remains uncertain
description: While the future of Chelsea football club remains in turmoil off the field, the team suffered a torrid night on the pitch in its Champions League quarterfinal first leg tie against Real Madrid on Wednesday.

title: 'They are not getting the full story': See how China is boosting Russian propaganda
description: As the world watches in horror the shocking images of the war in Ukraine, China's state-run media is choosing to show a starkly different narrative. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: The world's skinniest skyscraper is ready for its first residents
description: The world's skinniest skyscraper has been completed, adding a new landmark to Manhattan's famous skyline.

title: The Fed is ready to move faster on interest rates
description: The Federal Reserve is ready to raise interest rates at a faster pace to get a handle on America's pervasive inflation problem, according to minutes from the central bank's March meeting released Wednesday.

title: Janet Yellen warns of 'enormous' economic repercussions from war in Ukraine
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned Wednesday about the economic shock waves set off by the war in Ukraine, including disruptions to the global flow of food and energy.

title: Covid-19 infection triggers a 'fiery death' for certain cells in your body, study reveals
description: From the early days of the pandemic, doctors noticed that in severe cases of Covid-19 -- the ones that landed people in the hospital on ventilators with shredded lungs -- most of the internal wreckage wasn't being directly inflicted by the virus itself but by a blizzard of immune reactions triggered by the body to fight the infection.

title: H&M says you can compost its new line of baby clothes
description: H&M is coming out with a new line of baby clothes that can be recycled in an unexpected way once they're worn out — composting.

title: Why Selena Gomez hasn't been on Instagram in over four years
description: Selena Gomez, once crowned 'The Queen of Instagram,' tells ABC's Good Morning America how her mental health factored into her decision to stay off the social media platform.

title: The most-viewed episodes of 'Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown'
description: The legacy of the late Anthony Bourdain is a long and complicated one.

title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker only kind of got married
description: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker got married.

title: How YouTube's Bob and Brad got 430 million views by relieving pain
description: Bob Schrupp and Brad Heineck, known simply as Bob and Brad, are two Midwesterners who film pain relief videos from a storefront in Minnesota. CNN went to find out how they used simple and direct advice to gain over 4 million subscribers on YouTube.

title: The fight for this city may be 'the next pivotal battle' of Russia's war
Russia's changing approach: This may be 'next pivotal battle'
description: • Exclusive: 'Hard to deny' genocide in Ukraine, Polish President says

title: Nigerian atheist jailed 24 years for blasphemy
description: A Nigerian atheist and outspoken critic of religion was sentenced to 24 years in jail on Tuesday after pleading guilty to blasphemy charges in the largely Muslim northern state of Kano, in a ruling that puts a spotlight on religious freedoms in the country.

title: Burkina Faso's ex-president handed life sentence in absentia over predecessor's murder
description: Burkina Faso's former president Blaise Compaore was sentenced in absentia to life imprisonment for complicity in the 1987 murder of his predecessor Thomas Sankara in a coup, a military tribunal ruled on Wednesday.

title: Boris Johnson says transgender women should not compete in female sports
description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson has said that transgender women should not compete in female sports in comments he said he knew could be seen as "controversial."

title: What to know about Axiom Space, the company behind the first all-private mission to the ISS
description: In a historic first, a crew of four civilians are set to launch to the International Space Station this week as part of an inaugural mission for the commercial spaceflight company Axiom Space.

title: What Yemen's first nationwide truce in 6 years means for the world's worst humanitarian crisis
description: Yemen's warring parties have agreed to a nationwide truce for the first time since 2016. Meant to last for two months but eligible for renewal, it is the most significant step towards ending the hostilities since the war began seven years ago, and a win for United Nations and United States mediators who for the past year have been trying to engineer a permanent peace deal.

title: Russian car sales have collapsed
description: Auto sales in Russia plummeted by almost two-thirds in March, as the war in Ukraine, Western sanctions and an exodus of foreign businesses wreaked havoc on the country's economy.

title: Watch world's youngest opera singer perform
description: 10-year-old Victory Brinker holds the Guinness World Record as the world's youngest opera singer. In addition to professional performances, she was also on "America's Got Talent."

title: Michael Bay is ready for everyone to stop talking about the Will Smith slap
description: Director Michael Bay knows Will Smith from working with him on the first two "Bad Boys" films and has some feelings about "the slap."

title: Obama returned to the White House for first time. See how he poked fun at Biden
description: During his first visit back to the White House after leaving office, former President Barack Obama poked fun at his former vice president, President Joe Biden.

title: There's no end in sight for China's Covid lockdowns. Here's what you need to know
As the world reacts in horror to Bucha, China's state media strikes a different tone
description: Shocking images showing the bodies of civilians scattered across the streets of Bucha, a suburb of the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, have sparked global horror in recent days and raised the urgency of ongoing investigations into alleged Russian war crimes. But a starkly different narrative is playing out on China's state-run media.

title: Australia approves $2.6 billion missiles upgrade to counter assertive China
description: Australia will spend $2.6 billion (3.5 billion Australian dollars) to upgrade its defensive missiles as the security environment in the Asia-Pacific region becomes more challenging due to China's assertiveness, the country's defense minister said Tuesday.

title: Social media footage shows reality of China's zero-Covid strategy
description: China's megacity Shanghai is in week two of a strict Covid-19 lockdown, with no clear end in sight. CNN's Selina Wang reports on how residents are fed up and angry.

title: Michelangelo artwork, forgotten until 2019, could sell for $33 million
description: A drawing by Michelangelo, discovered in 2019, will be offered for sale next month by Christie's and could fetch 30 million euros ($33 million), the British auction house said on Tuesday.

title: Polish school welcomes thousands of Ukrainian students
description: CNN's Kyung Lah visits a public school in Warsaw, Poland, where teachers and students welcome Ukrainian refugee children because it's for a "good cause."

title: 'We are not going to let you go alone in this dark hour': Chef on food aid for Ukraine
description: In an interview with CNN's Anderson Cooper Chef Jose Andres talks abut the dangers and the importance of delivering food aid to Ukrainians.
